page.title: 02TRANSPORT SYSTEMS IN RHOOSE
page.content: Rhoose is bounded on its Northern side by a relatively new by-pass (opened in the mid-70's).Prior to this the village was served by the {B4265}. This road passes through the length of the village and used to carry a large amount of heavy traffic heading for the Aberthaw Cement Works, RAF St Athan or the Power Stations at East Aberthaw.Such traffic is now banned from the village and has resulted in a change of atmosphere along the length of what is known as {Fontygary Road.} To the{Southern and coastal}side Rhoose lies a railway track which serves as a goods line except on Sundays when the Paddington - Swansea train uses this stretch of track through the Vale of Glamorgan to allow maintenance work to be carried out on the main line. (cont.)
